meanings.definition: The quality of being corny or overly sentimental.
meanings.sent1: The movie's corninesses made it hard to take seriously.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't help but cringe at the corninesses of the love scene.
meanings.sent3: The corninesses of the romantic dialogue were so over-the-top, it was almost funny.
meanings.sent4: The corninesses of the play felt like a never-ending parade of clichés.
meanings.sent5: The corninesses of the song lyrics were so exaggerated, they stuck in my head for days.

meanings.definition: The state of being trite or cliché.
meanings.sent1: The corninesses of the jokes in the sitcom were predictable.
meanings.sent2: The film's corninesses were evident in its recycled plot.
meanings.sent3: The corninesses of the story were so expected, it was almost comforting.
meanings.sent4: The corninesses of the dialogue felt like a worn-out record playing on repeat.
meanings.sent5: The corninesses of the show's humor were as stale as day-old bread.

meanings.definition: Excessive sentimentality or predictability in a work of art or entertainment.
meanings.sent1: The corninesses of the soap opera were cringeworthy.
meanings.sent2: The novel's corninesses were a major turn-off for many readers.
meanings.sent3: The corninesses of the movie's ending were so exaggerated, it was almost laughable.
meanings.sent4: The corninesses of the painting's theme felt like a tired cliché.
meanings.sent5: The corninesses of the play's plot twists were so obvious, it ruined the suspense.
